Case reference: 2006026199.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1976 an unidentified male, believed to be between the ages of 30 to 40 years old, was found in the Niagara River, Niagara Falls, Ontario. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150-200 lbs and his length was measured at 5’5”-6'0", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, The names "Mary and Kim" in blue with a red flower on a green background

Case reference: 2014003733.CaseDesc: Gaétan Anglehart was last seen in a brewery with friends on June 2, 1975, in Montreal, Quebec. That night, Gaétan was seen being forced into a Cadillac vehicle.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Star on thumb and index finger
Left Shoulder, Dagger and inverted snake head and a name (unknown)

Case reference: 2014002762.CaseDesc: On March 3rd, 1982, Laurence Peterson and Randolph Johanson were reported missing by Mr. Johanson’s girlfriend. Mr. Johanson and Mr. Peterson were last seen on February 28th, 1982, leaving the Shelter Island Marina, on their boats. Mr. Johanson was reportedly using his 26 ft. long salvage tug boat to haul Mr. Peterson’s 43 ft. wooden halibut fishing vessel to Lund, BC. The men were reported missing when they did not arrive at their destination. Extensive searches were unsuccessful. It has been speculated that the two men disappeared to start a new life.

Teeth: Other, Wide space in between the front teeth
Scar: Chest, 1 inch scar on left breast

Case reference: 2020004223.CaseDesc: On December 24, 2019, Ryan Docherty was seen for the last time by his family in London, Ontario. The last known contact between Ryan and his friends was during the last week of December. On March 6, 2020, his mother reported him missing after returning from an extended trip, and noticing that Ryan had not shown up at her residence to retrieve some cheques.

Tattoo: Upper Back, Words: "EAZY-E"; gun and bullet
Left Hand, A heart with the name "Jodi"
Left Wrist, 6 eyes inside a triangle
Chest, Doc and Pennywise the clown
Scar: Right Hand, 3 inches on the top

Case reference: 2014004043.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2002, Eva Nakanjako, her husband Robert Mukwaya, and their son Emmanuel Mukwaya were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Eva and Robert had not shown for work for three weeks and had not paid their rent. During the time of their disappearance, their apartment was found partially emptied.

Case reference: 2017048277.CaseDesc: On August 20, 2017 at 11:00 pm, Christina Cooper was last seen leaving her boyfriend's residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004372.CaseDesc: Patrick-Jean De Loppinot was last seen on September 11, 2003, at a friend's residence in Laval. He was supposed to go home but never arrived. He left with a black 1990 Volkswagen Jetta registered in Québec. At the time of his disappearance, Mr. De Loppinot lived with family in Longueuil. He was reported missing by his family.

Case reference: 2014005532.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1984, Emily Koble had been picked up by two ladies that felt Mrs. Koble had appeared lost and confused. Mrs. Koble was dropped off near Christopher Lake, SK when she asked to get out of the vehicle. The ladies called the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, however, a search failed to locate Mrs. Koble.

Deformity: Shoulders, steel pin, unknown which shoulder

Case reference: 2017004343.CaseDesc: Mr. Landry Ntwari travelled to Niagara Falls on January 9, 2017, for a birthday celebration. He was a registered hotel guest staying at a downtown hotel. Since January 10th, there has been no further contact or no known sighting.

Case reference: 2014002843.CaseDesc: A party of 6 men departed Churchill, Manitoba, on a fishing trip traveling in three canoes. On June 20, 1967, two of the three canoes became stranded on mud flats at a point where the Hayes and Nelson Rivers empty into the Hudson Bay. The men made camp for the night and then the following day Kurt Hild, Ronald Davidson and James Cochrane all attempted to retrieve the stranded canoes. On return to the camp the men were confronted with high winds and freezing rain which forced them out of sight. None of the remains of the men have been recovered. Foul play is not suspected in the matter.

Case reference: 2006006899.CaseDesc: Ruth Jackson is an Alzheimer's patient, who was travelling in a car with her husband, who is also an Alzheimer's patient.  At some point, Mrs. Jackson got out of their vehicle and her husband drove off. He cannot recall where he left his wife. They were last seen together in the Elm Tree Road area of Kaladar.  An extensive air and ground search was conducted with negative results. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2013000134.CaseDesc: Loretta (Lora) Ann Frank was last seen in Yukon Territory between late 1988 and early 1989. She was known to reside in Watson Lake and Whitehorse, Yukon as well as Lower Post, British Columbia. Loretta was reported missing in 1993. Loretta is known to have a history of mental health concerns.

Case reference: 2014003380.CaseDesc: On May 9th, 1961, Brenda Byman was last seen on a hike with some classmates in the area of Wilmer, British Columbia, when she allegedly walked off into the bush and did not return. Brenda has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Blue, Parka, With pink hood

Case reference: 2014001782.CaseDesc: On May 2, 1972, Kenneth Kay was seen for the last time as he attended the First Nation Treaty days in Quinton, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014005339.CaseDesc: Gilles Lacroix, a priest, was last seen on August 31, 2009 in Boucherville. He was living in Longueuil. He left in his vehicle. His vehicle was found September 5, 2009.

Case reference: 2014001425.CaseDesc: On August 3rd, 1986, RCMP received a report of a missing person. The manager of Sickle Lake Lodge called advising Mr. Hrynick went missing in the early morning hours. Mr. Hrynick was with friends during the evening before and into the early morning. According to them, Mr. Hrynick had been very quiet over the couple days leading up to his disappearance. The evening of his disappearance, Mr. Hrynick was described as intoxicated. At one point, witnesses observed him stumbling on his way out the door of the cabin. The other men went out to search for Mr. Hrynick about 15 minutes later. They could hear a boat but could not see Mr. Hrynick. The empty boat was located the following day. An extensive land and water search failed to locate Mr. Hrynick. There was no indication that Mr. Hrynick found his way to the shore and he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2010001199.CaseDesc: Michael Hinsperger was in a canoe on Carson Lake, Barry's Bay, at 3:00 P.M. on May 13th 2010. The canoe was recovered but Mr. Hinsperger has not been located.

Jacket: Black, Yellow lettering "Harley Davidson Owners club"

Case reference: 2014005222.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2008, at approximately noon, Syed Zaman was seen for the last time at his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019016353.CaseDesc: On March 13th 2019 Michael Steele was seen for the last time at the Cape Breton Regional Hospital Emergency Department.

Case reference: 2006013199.CaseDesc: Heather Moggy was last seen on June 22, 2002. She may be in the company of John Tucsok who has been affiliated with the "THE ASSEMBLY OF GOD" church. Mr. Tucsok is wanted by the police for offences in Ontario. Heather and John had a joint post office box together in Brantford, Ontario, until September 2003. A letter has been received post marked from Calgary, Alberta. The last contact from Heather Moggy to her family was by telephone, in October 2003, when she indicated that they may be going to Saskatchewan (Moose Jaw).  As of this date, all attempts to locate either subject have failed.

Case reference: 2014004734.CaseDesc: Roland Langlois went missing from the Malartic hospital on August 13, 1978. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006015499.CaseDesc: Richard Ranger was last seen on March 4, 1999, at Buster's Confectionary on Main Street in Haileybury.  Richard had been admitted to the Temiskaming Hospital for psychiatric assessment the same day he went missing and may suffer from mental illness. His whereabouts are unknown and foul play is not suspected at this time.

Case reference: 2016066832.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1978, a body was recovered from the Detroit River. The body is believed to be that of a female. American money was found in the pockets of the pants. This person is believed to have been dead for several weeks to months.

Case reference: 2020006296.CaseDesc: On October 16, 1964, Carol Turner was last seen with two boys from the Black Diamond Riders Motorcycle Club in Toronto, Ontario. Earlier that evening, Carol had argued with her mother, and left the house after her mother had gone to sleep.

Case reference: 2014001247.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1989, Henry and his brother, William Gerbrand, were fishing in a canoe on Codette Lake near Nipawin, SK. At approximately 8:00 p.m., boaters heard calls for help. It is suspected that both men drowned; divers were unable to find them.

Case reference: 2013000059.CaseDesc: Normand Pellerin was last seen on July 4, 1999, at a fireworks show in the vicinity of the Jacques-Cartier Bridge in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014002841.CaseDesc: Michel Gagné was last seen on June 29, 1982, in Montreal, QC. Mr. Gagné left his friend's mother's home to go with him to a medical clinic. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005083.CaseDesc: Alexander Belcourt was reported missing by his family in November 1995. He has not been seen or heard from since September 1991. During the time of his disappearance, Alexander was known to live in the inner core of Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2019052051.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2019, at approximately 4:00 am, Brandon Pollock was seen for the last time at his family residence in Hamilton, Ontario. That same morning, three men on a boat observed a man swimming in the area of the Lift Bridge in Lake Ontario. The men approached the swimmer, who was later identified as Brandon Pollock, to confirm his wellbeing. Brandon had told them that he was okay and advised them to pass by.

Mark: Right Side Of Neck, A brown birthmark on the right side of the neck, below the ear

Case reference: 2014003295.CaseDesc: Wayne Ronald Baker was reported missing on June 8, 1989 after not reporting to his shift at Phil's Restaurant in Banff, Alberta.  He was last seen by his roommate in staff accommodation the evening of June 7. Wayne Baker may have been seen in Edmonton at the Crest Hotel in July 1989.

Case reference: 2022009358.CaseDesc: On March 17, 2005, shortly after midnight, Patricia Bessel was last seen leaving her residence in Grand Island, New York. Patricia’s vehicle was subsequently located in a parking lot near the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of her disappearance, Patricia was despondent

Case reference: 2014005307.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2006, Kevin Lim, Yee Wah Eva Ho and her boyfriend Jackie Li were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Kevin, Yee Wah Eva and Jackie had been friends with Philip Sit who had been reported missing in 2005. Philip’s remains were found five days prior to Eva, Kevin and Jackie’s disappearance. Philip had been the victim of a homicide.

Hair: Black, Other, Dyed red and styled with spikes

Case reference: 2015060160.CaseDesc: On May 27, 1970, a male was found floating in the water at the foot of Seguins Boat House in Rockcliffe, Ottawa. He has partially balding, grey hair. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 158 lbs and his length was measured at 5'8", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. Several anterior and posterior teeth were missing in the upper and lower jaw. He had 1 cent and a pack of matches in his pocket. It is believed that he had been in the water for up to 48 hours prior to recovery.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Several anterior and posterior teeth were missing in the upper and lower jaw.
Watch: Gold, Gold band with expansion; with the inscribed initials "C.I.B."
Scar: Left Side Of Head, 1.5 x 1 cm slightly depressed scar on his left temple

Case reference: 2018063038.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1998, at approximately 12:00 p.m., Beverley Cole was last seen leaving her group home in Toronto, Ontario. Beverley had left with all of her personal belongings.

Case reference: 2014001684.CaseDesc: On June 30th, 1974 Brent Forsyth was 11 years of age when he went missing while fishing along the Bulkley River by Two Mile Creek in Hazelton BC. Brent was last seen upriver fishing a back-eddy. As a result of Brent's disappearance an extensive search involving community members, search and rescue, RCMP Police Dog Services and RCMP air service entailed. Despite these efforts and continued investigations he has never been located. Police have received new information about Brent and are seeking anyone who might have additional information about Brent's disappearance to come forward.

Deformity: Nick on the top right ear

Case reference: 2008016999.CaseDesc: Meryl Newcombe and George Weeden were last seen and reported missing to the White River OPP on October 29, 1959. The two men had been at a lodge operated by Mr. Newcombe at Mile 107 of the CPR line, west of Chapleau, Ontario. Mr. Weeden and Mr. Newcombe had planned a hunting trip and both were last seen between mile marker 106 and 107 of the CPR line southeast of White River and west of Chapleau. A large-scale search was conducted at the time, and again in the following spring (1960).  The search failed to locate the two men, and to date, they have not been located. Mr. Weeden exact date of birth is not known, but his year of birth is understood to be 1896 or 1897.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Leg, injured in a train wreck in 1941

Case reference: 2018040276.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1992, at approximately 12:00pm, Luom Truong was last seen leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to leaving his home, Luom and his mother had an argument.

Case reference: 2014005295.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2007, at approximately 10:30 p.m., Javed Hoosain was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Javed had a dispute with his mother prior to leaving his residence.

Case reference: 2014005084.CaseDesc: On February 1, 2008, it is suspected the Kevin Leroux went through the ice on his ATV, near St Joseph's Cove, NL. His ATV was recovered several months later, about 22 km from where he was suspected of going through the ice but his body was never found.

Case reference: 2006013499.CaseDesc: Vital Vachon was last seen on May 1, 1973 when he departed a bush camp in Lucas Township, near Timmins, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001164.CaseDesc: On June 29, 2005, a man was found in the St. Lawrence River at 333 of the Commune (near the Old Port Clock). The man had a Egyptian cross pendant that he wore at his waist.

Jewelry: Metal, pendant of an Egyptian cross

Case reference: 2020011478.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1988, Mary McCarthy was seen for the last time at her apartment in Toronto, Ontario. Mary’s vehicle was later found on November 17, 1988 at the bus depot in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Mary was a chartered accountant working for CSA Management Ltd. at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014002651.CaseDesc: Mabel Leo was last seen leaving a party near Nairn Falls, Pemberton, BC, in 1969, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006005899.CaseDesc:
On August 19, 1994, the body of a Caucasian male was found in the Niagara River. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 134 lbs and his length was measured between 5’8"-5’9",  however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
His appendix was present. He is believed to have been in the water several days to weeks.

Teeth: Teeth were natural, a few restorations on his lower right posterior teeth.
Scar: Front surface of his left wrist, 1cm in length
Inner surface of his right wrist, 1cm in length
Two scars on his left forehead, 1cm-2cm in length

Case reference: 2019043440.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2019, Victor Cuthand was reported missing from the City of Brockville, Ontario. Victor’s last known whereabouts were at a shelter located in downtown Toronto, Ontario, as of March, 2020. This was also the last time that Victor had communicated with his family.

Case reference: 2020007343.CaseDesc: Marie Lyons had been living with her aunt after she had fled from her abusive husband. On April 12, 1971, Marie was last seen when her husband picked her up from her aunt’s residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Shoes: Brown, Laced; Low cut with laces

Case reference: 2006007899.CaseDesc: Edward Michael Krantz was last seen on August 23, 1975. He paddled alone into Lake Huron to go fishing, in a 17 foot aluminium MICHI Craft canoe, serial MCC11799M74JF7. Mr. Krantz and the canoe have never been located.

Socks: White, Knee high, yellow top stripe
Pants: Orange, Red, white and blue striped pants
Scar: Lower Back, 25 inch vertical scar from surgery

Case reference: 2014006301.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2013, at 4:30, Alexis St-Denis was at his residence in Trois-Rivières. He sent a text to several people saying “Im so sorry”. Later on, a passerby found a cell phone, wallet, and headphones belonging to Alexis on the Pont de Fer bridge on the river Saint-Maurice near Highway 40. He has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2016043636.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1976, the body of a woman was discovered in a backyard in the Parkdale area of Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005451.CaseDesc: John W. Burton along with two passengers (Clifford Dowson and Edward Flett) were flying from Oxford House to Island Lake. Mr. Burton was the pilot of the Cessna 185. Around 11:00 am Mr. Burton made a routine call stating that the airplane would be landing in Garden Hill in approximately 15 minutes. The airplane did not arrive at its destination. The wreckage and all three on board were never located.

Case reference: 2006026799.CaseDesc: On Friday, May 19, 1967, at about 06:10 A.M,. Victor Morris left his cottage on the South Shore of Lake Nipissing in an 18 foot Geisler Cedar Strip boat with an 18 hp motor. On Sunday, May 21 1967, the boat was recovered on Manitou Island in Lake Nipissing. The boat was partially burnt and the motor showed signs of having exploded.

Case reference: 2020008724.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1979, Irvin Lasinskas was last seen at the Wellesley Hospital in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Irvin was despondent.

Case reference: 2014004386.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2003, Adolph Sewap was last seen in Sturgeon Landing near Creighton, Saskatchewan. Adolph had some medical issues and was known to travel to other communities.

Other: Walks bent forward with hands behind his back

Case reference: 2013000132.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2008 Trevor Warkentin left the Pyschiatric Ward at the MSA Hospital in Abbotsford BC. A hospital staff worker believes seeing Trevor get into a red pick up truck, but no license plate was obtained.

Teeth: Good, Large gap between front teeth

Case reference: 2014004814.CaseDesc: Stephanie Stewart was employed as a Fire Spotter at the Athabasca Lookout near Hinton, Alberta when she disappeared on August 26, 2006. She was 70 years old at the time of her disappearance. Stephanie led an active lifestyle and was in good health. Her disappearance is being treated as suspicious. The police investigation is ongoing.

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004849.CaseDesc: In the evening of November 21, 2006, Yves Castonguay left his residence in Bécancour, Gentilly sector. He may have been spotted a few times; however Mr. Castonguay has had no contact with his family since this date. His family have reason to fear for his health and safety.

Case reference: 2012020069.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1982, a Gimli resident reported that in 1972 Debbie Richardson arrived in Gimli to visit her brother.  According to this report, she stayed with him for approximately three months, then went missing. Debbie's brother last saw her in September, 1972, when he dropped her off on a highway so that she could hitchhike to Winnipeg.  She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003272.CaseDesc: On December 30, 1967 Michael Smith left his North Vancouver residence. Mr. Smith had been despondent over a friend’s death and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003250.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1974, four people left the Whitedog Indian Reserve, Ontario in a 14' Lund boat and were heading for Pointe du Bois, Manitoba. Their intention was to go to Pointe du Bois to pick up supplies and then return to Whitedog. On November 5, 1974, these individuals were reported missing as they had never returned to Whitedog.  It is believed that the boat overturned and everyone drowned. Two bodies were recovered, and the cause of death was determined to be drowning. Searches were conducted by boat and by air but the bodies of Paul Scott and Richard Petawanahqueb were never recovered.  Mr. Scott and Mr. Petawanahqueb are presumed dead due to drowning. No foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2014005200.CaseDesc: Conrad Hastings was last seen at the bus shelter at Smith Street and Portage Avenue.  His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2022006110.CaseDesc: On January 24, 2022, Steven Pinch was last seen in downtown area of Calgary, AB.  Steven is known to frequent the city of Red Deer, Alberta, and the town of Rocky Mountain House, Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020045.CaseDesc: The RCMP is seeking assistance in locating Shirley Ann WAQUAN. She was last seen on July 1, 2007 in Fort McMurray.

Case reference: 2006019499.CaseDesc: David Block was reported missing from Swastika, Ontario. He had been seen in Newfoundland in 1994.  Mr. Block suffered from mental health issues that could bring him to the attention of authorities. He was last seen in Washington D.C., U.S.A, on May 1, 1995.

Case reference: 2012020148.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from English Bay in Vancouver

Pants: Grey, Green, With a frog logo
Shoes: Leather, White, Grey, Made in Italy

Case reference: 2021008992.CaseDesc: On March 7, 2021, Konstantin Boukhanov travelled to Toronto, Ontario without telling his family. Konstantin has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003643.CaseDesc: Dean Mortensen was reported missing on January 24, 1992, after he failed to attend his classes at the University of Alberta in Edmonton, Alberta. Dean was last seen by his friends leaving the on campus bar, The Ship. They parted ways with him within 200 metres of his dorm room at the St. Joseph's College that night.

Jacket: Grande Cache Bantam Elks leather hockey jacket with gold shoulders, white collar, "Dean" on sleeve
Shirt: ST JOSEPH, St. Joseph crest on front

Case reference: 2014006160.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1978, George Heys left his residence for an appointment in Toronto, Ontario. George has not been seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014000020.CaseDesc: Lorraine Roach was last seen at home at approximately 1:30 a.m. on May 11, 2013, by her husband. He indicated that she was upset over a family matter and was heading to the local casino. She left driving her vehicle, which was later found parked on the side of the road near a walking trail about 7 kilometers from her home. She never went to the casino that evening.

Pierce: Ears, both ears have 3 piercings with diamond studs

Case reference: 2020016024.CaseDesc: In July of 2019, Anita Grace Wechsler was seen and heard from for the last time in Calgary, Alberta. During the time of Anita’s disappearance, she may have been despondent and involved in a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014003434.CaseDesc: On the evening of May 18, 1986, Monique Brosseau was seen for the last time at her home in Duhamel-Ouest, Quebec.

Case reference: 2007002299.CaseDesc: Michelle Bigras last spoke to her mother on October 11, 1985. At the time she was planning to hitchhike to Warkworth Institution, located near Warkworth, Ontario, to visit her boyfriend. She never arrived.

Scar: Eyes, 2 small scars on left eyebrow

Case reference: 2014006562.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2014, Kamalanathan Kandasamy was seen for the last time in Markham, Ontario. His backpack, which contained all of his personal effects and his identification, was found near the Horseshoe Falls in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005574.CaseDesc: Judy Chescue was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in October 1988.  Judy was last seen near her home in Edmonton in July 1988.

Case reference: 2016068328.CaseDesc: This male foot was found washed up on the shore of Gull Island in Presqu'ile Provincial Park. The foot was inside a black "PUMA" ankle sock and a size 11 women's "Mizuno Wave Prophecy" running shoe. The shoe was first available for sale in Spring 2011. The post-mortem interval is anywhere from one month to 2 and a half years.

Case reference: 2013000050.CaseDesc: William 'Billy' Weinbender has been missing since approximately 7:30pm on May 6th, 1994 from Winnipeg. At the time he went missing he was living in an apartment building in the North End of the city. Mr. Weinbender was last seen in the McPhillips Street and Leila Avenue area of Winnipeg.

Case reference: 2006027099.CaseDesc: Mr. Deorksen and two acquaintances were travelling on Kioshkokwi lake, Pentland Township, Kiosk, Ontario, in a canoe when it capsized. The two acquaintances were located deceased, but Mr. Deorksen has never been found and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014002517.CaseDesc: Hélène Laferrière was seen for the last time on October 5, 1976, in the Saint-Sacrement District in Quebec City, Quebec. Hélène has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2017073521.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2017, an unidentified woman was recovered from Lake Ontario near Humber Bay Shores Park, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts she was of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2014004827.CaseDesc: On July 6, 2004, 41 year old Jacqueline "Jackie" Bob was last seen picking mushrooms in the Brittany Triangle of the Nemiah Valley.

Case reference: 2014005363.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1986, Edward Beauchamp failed to meet with his probation officer for a scheduled appointment in Edmonton, Alberta. Edward has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, "Born To Be Wild"
Left Forearm, "Born to Raise Hell 1952 Eddie"
Right Hand, "Love" on backs of fingers
Left Hand, Club, diamond, spade and heart on knuckles
Left Hand, "Hate" on backs of fingers
Right Forearm, Cobra and tumbleweed chief
Right Upper Arm , "Born to be free"

Case reference: 2017062421.CaseDesc: Matthew Wiinikainen was seen for the last time on March 30, 1995 in Gaspé, Quebec. Matthew was in detention at the Youth Center “Unité La Rade”, located in Gaspé hospital area, Quebec. He escaped around 11:00 p.m. during the change of the guard.

Case reference: 2021056492.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1991, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered near Placentia Bay in Newfoundland and Labrador. He is believed to have been between 6’0 and 6’2 in height.

Case reference: 2014005330.CaseDesc: On September 13, 2009, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Rose Mackinnon was seen for the last time when she left the Earnestine Women’s shelter with her two children. Rose advised that she would be returning but has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2016066830.CaseDesc:
On June 13, 1967, the remains of a male were discovered in the Detroit River at the Canada Steamship Dock, at the foot of Prospect Street. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
He is thought to have been dead for several months.

Hair: Brown, Dark brown with a few grey hairs
Shirt: Dark Blue, Dark blue sport shirt, size 15-15 1/2, Made in Canada
Sweater: Brown, Cardigan sweater labeled "Knit to Fit";
Suit: Dark Blue, Double-breasted suit with a faint dark stripe
Boots: Black, Hiking-type boots, size nine, "Pathfinder" brand

Case reference: 2022016834.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2022, Shawn Mines was seen for the last time doing renovations in a residence in Portage La Praire, Manitoba. A week prior to his disappearance, Shawn’s mother passed away, and he was despondent.

Case reference: 2012020053.CaseDesc: Jennifer Catcheway has been missing since Thursday June 19, 2008. Ms. Catcheway was seen at approximately 12:00 pm leaving Grand Rapids en route to Portage la Prairie, Manitoba.  During her travels it is believed that she was dropped off near the Waterhen junction - Provincial Road 328 and PTH #6. Ms. Catcheway has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002126.CaseDesc: On March 18, 1997, Mark Bird was seen for the last time when he left his home in Welland, Ontario. His abandoned vehicle was later found in Niagara Falls. At the time of his disappearance, Mark was despondent and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Black, Hooded, San Francisco 49's football team

Case reference: 2016034244.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on October 31, 1981 about 7 kms east of Hinton, AB just off Highway #16. The individual did not have teeth and no dentures were found with the body.

Case reference: 2014004301.CaseDesc: Zolton Zambory was reported missing by his estranged wife on January 24, 1965. On January 30, 1965, Vancouver City Police located his vehicle abandoned in Vancouver. His vehicle was unlocked with his personal belongings left behind. He emigrated from Germany and arrived in Quebec on May, 1957.

Case reference: 2013000065.CaseDesc: Pierrette Courcelles was last seen on November 22, 1991 in Montreal.

Tattoo: Right Arm, picture of a heart, a cross and an eagle with "ROBERT" (text)

Case reference: 2012020160.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from Cypress Mountain, West Vancouver. He was fully clothed, inside a sleeping bag.

Teeth: Protruding Lowers, Distinctive under bite, 2 porcelain crowns on bottom front teeth which were noticeably more white
Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Gold, "Seiko" brand

Case reference: 2019040207.CaseDesc: On July 16, 2015, Denis Chernov was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Before he was reported missing, Denis had not been seen or heard from for four years.

Case reference: 2013000129.CaseDesc: Immaculate Basil was last seen June 14, 2013 on a road in a remote area north of Fort St James, BC.

Case reference: 2014002718.CaseDesc: Wayne Robinson was last seen on October 8, 1985, running away from his school in God's Lake, Manitoba. It is unclear what prompted Wayne to leave school during the recess period. An extensive air, water and land search was conducted with no success.

Case reference: 2008005099.CaseDesc: On January 26, 1976, Robert McDonald’s employer advised that he had not shown up for work and had not been seen since January 16, 1976. On January 28, 1976 it was reported that Mr. McDonald was seen hitchhiking south out of Ear Falls on Highway 105. Mr. McDonald has not been seen since. He was 33 years old at the time of his disappearance and was last seen at Griffith Mines, north of Ear Falls, ON.

Jacket: Blue, White, skidoo with white stripes

Case reference: 2014002495.CaseDesc: Linda Scott was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in April 2000. Linda was last heard from by a family member in March 2000. She is normally in contact with family at least once a week. Linda was believed to be last seen with friends.

Case reference: 2012020144.CaseDesc: This body was recovered from the Esquimalt Lagoon.

Teeth: Braces, Upper jaw intact and shows clear evidence of dental work (metal fillings).

Case reference: 2014002146.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1984, John Lake  was last seen leaving a hospital in Vancouver, British Columbia. He stated he was heading to Seattle.

Scar: Left Side Of Head, From ear to chin
